definition: the whole front (in a war)/the whole length (of a road or railway line)
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: All 30 stocks in the Dow Jones industrial average fell. The index closed down 279.65 points, or 2.22 percent, at 12,290.14.
sentences.chinese: 道瓊斯工業平均指數的30只股票全線下跌。

sentences.english: I just love this lotion and the whole line of products.
sentences.chinese: 我只喜歡這款乳液以及這個品牌的全線產品。

sentences.english: The whole railway line has been joined up.
Responsible for all products in your terrain.
sentences.chinese: 負責區域內全線產品的業務。

sentences.english: They attacked all along the line and gave the enemy no breathing spell.
sentences.chinese: 他們發起全線總攻，不給敵人以任何喘息機會。

sentences.english: Please stand behind the yellow safety line while waiting for the train.
sentences.chinese: 請您站在黃色安全線以內排隊候車。

sentences.english: The report notes that he had not used any safety line for the wreck penetration.
sentences.chinese: 報告指出他穿越沉船時沒有使用任何安全線。

sentences.english: The enemy crumpled under our attacks.
sentences.chinese: 敵軍在我軍攻擊下全線崩潰。

sentences.english: All KARESS products are appropriate for use on this skin type.
sentences.chinese: KARESS全線產品均適用於此肌膚類型。

sentences.english: Club InterContinental located on the 46th floor has a panoramic view of the city.
sentences.chinese: 洲際俱樂部位於酒店46層，可坐享濱城全線海景。

sentences.english: They decided to wage a war of attrition rather than to rely on an all-out attack.
sentences.chinese: 他們決定打一場消耗戰，而不搞全線出擊。

sentences.english: We're going now to the security line at your local airport.
sentences.chinese: 我們先看看當地機場安全線的報道。

sentences.english: Dian-yue railroad entire line segment north and south two big sections.
sentences.chinese: 滇越鐵路全線分南北兩大段。

sentences.english: The current line has returned to normal traffic.
sentences.chinese: 目前全線已恢復正常通車。

sentences.english: One way to detect fake money is to look for the metal strip.
sentences.chinese: 識別真假鈔票的方法之一是看它有沒有安全線。

sentences.english: Probably not in partnership with a full-line manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌可能也不會與某家全線廠商進行合作。

definition: to open up (windows for air, ideas for discussion, transportation routes etc)
to open to traffic (e.g. new bridge, rail line etc)/(of a locality) to have a transportation service/(Tw) to commute
Da Qiao, one of the Two Qiaos, according to Romance of the Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4], the two great beauties of ancient China
to lay (railroad tracks, carpet, pipeline)/to install (wiring, cable)/to construct (road, concrete slab)
to escalate (in intensity)/to go up by one grade/to be promoted/to upgrade (computing)
to move along one's course (of celestial bodies etc)/(fig.) to function/to be in operation/(of a train service etc) to operate/to run/(of a computer) to run
to be in operation/to do business/(of train, bus etc) to be in service/operation/service
